intro: Carinta repens var. comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy cyathium flowers. The plant typically grows as a low herbaceous perennial with branching stems and alternate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires careful handling due to its irritant properties.
